description: The royal palace of Boa Hancock on Amazon Lily, where she resides as the empress of the Kuja tribe and Pirate Empress. The palace is ornate and features snake motifs throughout its architecture.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Brought to Hancock's Palace
keyEvents.description: After passing Hancock's test, Luffy is brought to her palace where she will reveal her deepest secret in private.
keyEvents.significance: The palace serves as the private setting for Hancock's confession, symbolizing Luffy entering her inner world and earning her trust.

keyEvents.title: The Slave Brand Revealed
keyEvents.description: Inside the palace, Hancock reveals the Hoof of the Celestial Dragon on her back, exposing the truth about her enslavement.
keyEvents.significance: The palace's privacy allows Hancock to reveal her most guarded secret away from the eyes of her people.

keyEvents.title: Hancock's Emotional Breakdown
keyEvents.description: In the safety of her palace, Hancock cries openly about her trauma for the first time in years.
keyEvents.significance: The palace represents Hancock's private sanctuary where she can finally be vulnerable.

statusHistory.reason: Palace is the active residence of Boa Hancock

description: The holy land of the World Government, located at the top of the Red Line. Home to the Celestial Dragons (World Nobles) and the seat of world power. Site of slavery and the location Fisher Tiger raided to free slaves.

keyEvents.title: Hancock Enslaved at Mary Geoise
keyEvents.description: Through flashback, it is revealed that Hancock and her sisters were brought to Mary Geoise as slaves for the Celestial Dragons when they were twelve years old.
keyEvents.significance: Mary Geoise is established as the site of horrific slavery and abuse, showing the dark underbelly of the World Government's holy city.

keyEvents.title: Four Years of Slavery
keyEvents.description: Hancock describes the four years of torture and abuse she endured at Mary Geoise under the Celestial Dragons.
keyEvents.significance: This revelation exposes Mary Geoise as a location of systemic cruelty and oppression beneath its holy facade.

keyEvents.title: Fisher Tiger's Raid on Mary Geoise
keyEvents.description: Hancock reveals that Fisher Tiger climbed the Red Line, attacked Mary Geoise, set it on fire, and freed all the slaves including the Boa sisters.
keyEvents.significance: This establishes Mary Geoise as the site of one of the most significant acts of rebellion in One Piece history - the only successful attack on the holy city.

statusHistory.reason: Mary Geoise continues as the World Government capital

significance: Mary Geoise is revealed to be not just the holy land of the World Government, but also a site of slavery and horrific abuse. The Hoof of the Celestial Dragon brand originates here, and Fisher Tiger's liberation of slaves from this location is one of the most heroic acts in the series.
